attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The word "ofcourse" is used all the time in speech and writing, and is a valid alternative to "of course". "of course" is awkward and clunky, and the combination is more audibly pleasing, it flows in conversation whereas if "of course" is used as spelt, the sentence doesn't flow smoothly.
Thankyou

Continuing with the theme of flowing, "the 19 days of course" is a pretty good name for it.

rejection.details: The PM does not have the power to approve which words are accepted into the English language.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
